clinical_study.brief_title: Kinetics of Biomarkers in Acute Pyelonephritis
clinical_study.official_title: Kinetics of Procalcitonin, C-reactive Protein and Pyuria in Uncomplicated Pyelonephritis in Women: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to explore the kinetics of biomarkers in 30 adult female patients with uncomplicated acute pyelonephritis.

detailed_description.textblock: We will measure c-reactive protein, procalcitonin, pyuria and a new blood biomarker (Signature TM) everyday till normalization of these markers in 30 adult female patients with uncomplicated acute pyelonephritis.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood and urine biomarkers (procalcitonin, C-reactive protein, SIGNATURE(TM) test, pyuria

study_pop.textblock: 30 adult females with acute uncomplicated pyelonephritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years
- Flank/loin pain or tenderness, or both and fever > 38Â°C during the last 48 hours and pyuria
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Presence of indwelling catheters
- Known polycystic kidney disease or any malformation of the urinary tract, or single kidney; renal transplant recipients; acute or chronic renal failure requiring dialysis
- Recent discharge from hospital (during the last 10 days); ongoing antibiotic treatment
- Known severe immunosuppression: Receiver of solid-organ or hematopoietic stem cells transplants; neutropenia ( < 1 G neutrophils / L); chronic (more than 14 days) use of systemic glucocorticoids (>10 mg/d of prednisone); active use of immunosuppressive therapy for the treatment of auto-immune or inflammatory disease; HIV infection with < 350 CD4+ cells / ml or unknown CD4+ status
- Pyelonephritis initially identified as complicated: obstruction of urinary tract, urinary stone; history of renal infection in the last 15 days
- Patient with severe sepsis or septic shock
